TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit ASCIIEncoding extends System.Text.Encoding

summary.span: Represents an ASCII character encoding of Unicode characters.

span.span: Represents an ASCII character encoding of Unicode characters.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 编码是将一组 Unicode 字符转换为一个字节序列的过程。Encoding is the process of transforming a set of Unicode characters into a sequence of bytes. 解码是一组 Unicode 字符转换为编码字节的序列的过程。Decoding is the process of transforming a sequence of encoded bytes into a set of Unicode characters. 对应于 Windows 代码页 20127。 corresponds to the Windows code page 20127. 由于 ASCII 是 7 位编码，ASCII 字符仅限于从 U + 0000 到 U + 007F 的最低 128 个 Unicode 字符。Because ASCII is a 7-bit encoding, ASCII characters are limited to the lowest 128 Unicode characters, from U+0000 to U+007F. 如果使用返回的默认编码器属性或执行编码操作之前，会用问号 （？） 替换构造函数，该范围以外的字符。If you use the default encoder returned by the property or the constructor, characters outside that range are replaced with a question mark (?) before the encoding operation is performed. 因为类支持仅一个有限的字符集， ， ，和类是更好地适合全球化应用程序。Because the class supports only a limited character set, the , , and classes are better suited for globalized applications. 以下注意事项可以帮助您决定是否使用:The following considerations can help you to decide whether to use : - 某些协议要求 ASCII 或 ASCII 的子集。Some protocols require ASCII or a subset of ASCII. 在这些情况下 ASCII 编码是适当的。In these cases ASCII encoding is appropriate. - 如果需要 8 位编码，则 ASCII 可能不正确的选择。If an 8-bit encoding is expected, then ASCII probably isn't the correct choice. 相反，请考虑使用 UTF8 而不 ASCII。Instead, consider using UTF8 instead of ASCII. 对于字符 U + 0000 到 U + 007F，结果是相同的但所有 Unicode 字符可表示采用 utf-8，这会避免数据丢失。For the characters U+0000 through U+007F, the results are identical, but all Unicode characters are representable in UTF-8, which avoids data loss. > [!CAUTION] > 不提供错误检测。 does not provide error detection. 出于安全原因，应使用， ，或并启用错误检测。For security reasons, you should use , , or and enable error detection. 方法确定将多少个字节进行编码的一组 Unicode 字符和方法执行实际的编码。The method determines how many bytes result in encoding a set of Unicode characters, and the method performs the actual encoding. 同样，方法确定有多少个字符的字节序列进行解码所导致和和方法执行实际的解码。Likewise, the method determines how many characters result in decoding a sequence of bytes, and the and methods perform the actual decoding. 请注意，默认值构造函数本身可能没有你的应用程序的适当行为。Note that the default constructor by itself might not have the appropriate behavior for your application. 你可能想要考虑设置或属性或以防止与设置第 8 位的序列。You might want to consider setting the or property to or to prevent sequences with the 8th bit set. 自定义行为也可能适合于这种情况。Custom behavior might also be appropriate for these cases. ## Examples 下面的示例演示了如何编码成 ASCII Unicode 字符。The following example demonstrates how to encode Unicode characters into ASCII. 请注意出现时你的应用程序使用的数据丢失ASCII 范围之外的 Unicode 字符进行编码。Notice the loss of data that occurs when your application uses to encode Unicode characters outside of the ASCII range. [!code-cpp[System.Text.ASCIIEncoding Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Text.ASCIIEncoding Example/CPP/snippet.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Text.ASCIIEncoding Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Text.ASCIIEncoding Example/CS/snippet.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Text.ASCIIEncoding Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Text.ASCIIEncoding Example/VB/snippet.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks > [!CAUTION] > 类不提供错误检测。The class does not provide error detection. 出于安全原因，应使用， ，或类并启用错误检测。For security reasons, you should use the , , or class and enable error detection. 如果你选择使用 ASCII 编码，则此构造函数可能无法为应用程序提供适当的回退行为。If you choose to use ASCII encoding, this constructor may not provide the appropriate fallback behavior for your application. 它使用和类将替换为问号 （？） 的 U + 0000 到 U + 007F 范围之外的每个字符。It uses the and classes to replace every character outside the range of U+0000 through U+007F with a question mark (?). 相反，您可以调用或方法并将其传递和对象使用异常回退。Instead, you can call the or method and pass it and objects to use exception fallback. > [!NOTE] > 仅支持的 Unicode 字符值之间 U + 0000 到 U + 007F。 supports only the Unicode character values between U+0000 and U+007F. 因此， ， ，和更适合全球化应用程序。Therefore, , , and are better suited for globalized applications. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何创建一个新实例，并显示编码的名称。The following example demonstrates how to create a new instance and display the name of the encoding. [!code-cpp[System.Text.ASCIIEncoding.ctor Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Text.ASCIIEncoding.ctor Example/CPP/ctor.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Text.ASCIIEncoding.ctor Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Text.ASCIIEncoding.ctor Example/CS/ctor.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Text.ASCIIEncoding.ctor Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Text.ASCIIEncoding.ctor Example/VB/ctor.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要计算所需的精确数组大小为了存储所产生的字节，应用程序使用。To calculate the exact array size required by to store the resulting bytes, the application uses . 若要计算的最大数组大小，应用程序应使用。To calculate the maximum array size, the application should use . 方法通常允许您分配的内存越少，而方法通常执行得更快。The method generally allows allocation of less memory, while the method generally executes faster. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用方法返回的字符串使用进行编码所需的字节数。The following example demonstrates how to use the method to return the number of bytes required to encode a string using . remarks.format: ## Remarks 若要计算所需的精确数组大小来存储所产生的字符，该应用程序使用。To calculate the exact array size required by to store the resulting characters, the application uses . 若要计算的最大数组大小，应用程序应使用。To calculate the maximum array size, the application should use . 方法通常允许您分配的内存越少，而方法通常执行得更快。The method generally allows allocation of less memory, while the method generally executes faster. 数据转换，如从流中读取的数据可以是仅在连续的块中可用。Data to be converted, such as data read from a stream, can be available only in sequential blocks. 在这种情况下，或如果的数据量太大，因此需要划分为较小的块，应用程序应使用或由方法或方法，分别。In this case, or if the amount of data is so large that it needs to be divided into smaller blocks, the application should use the or the provided by the method or the method, respectively. 不提供错误检测。 does not provide error detection. 任何大于 0x7F 十六进制的字节解码为 Unicode 问号 ("？")。Any byte greater than hexadecimal 0x7F is decoded as the Unicode question mark ("?"). > [!CAUTION] > 出于安全原因，你的应用程序建议使用， ，或并启用错误检测。For security reasons, your application is recommended to use , , or and enable error detection. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何进行解码的字节数组中的元素范围，并将结果存储在一组 Unicode 字符数组中的元素。The following example demonstrates how to decode a range of elements from a byte array and store the result in a set of elements in a Unicode character array. summary.span: Obtains a decoder that converts an ASCII encoded sequence of bytes into a sequence of Unicode characters.

span.span: Obtains a decoder that converts an ASCII encoded sequence of bytes into a sequence of Unicode characters.

returns.span: A that converts an ASCII encoded sequence of bytes into a sequence of Unicode characters.

span.span: A that converts an ASCII encoded sequence of bytes into a sequence of Unicode characters.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将连续的字节块转换为连续的块中的字符，方式类似于此类的方法。The method converts sequential blocks of bytes into sequential blocks of characters, in a manner similar to the method of this class. 但是，因此它可以正确地对跨块的字节序列进行解码的调用之间维护状态信息。However, a maintains state information between calls so it can correctly decode byte sequences that span blocks. 还会保留在数据块的末尾的尾随字节，在下一步的解码操作中使用的尾随字节。The also preserves trailing bytes at the end of data blocks and uses the trailing bytes in the next decoding operation. 因此，和在网络传输和文件操作很有用，因为这些操作通常处理的数据而不是完整的数据流块。Therefore, and are useful for network transmission and file operations, because those operations often deal with blocks of data instead of a complete data stream.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.Text.Encoder GetEncoder ();
.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Text.Encoder GetEncoder() cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetEncoder () As Encoder
public: override System::Text::Encoder ^ GetEncoder();
override this.GetEncoder : unit -> System.Text.Encoder

summary.span: Obtains an encoder that converts a sequence of Unicode characters into an ASCII encoded sequence of bytes.

span.span: Obtains an encoder that converts a sequence of Unicode characters into an ASCII encoded sequence of bytes.

returns.span: An that converts a sequence of Unicode characters into an ASCII encoded sequence of bytes.

span.span: An that converts a sequence of Unicode characters into an ASCII encoded sequence of bytes.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法将连续的字符块转换为连续的块中的字节，方式类似于此类的方法。The method converts sequential blocks of characters into sequential blocks of bytes, in a manner similar to the method of this class. 但是，以便其可以进行正确编码跨块的字符序列的调用之间维护状态信息。However, an maintains state information between calls so it can correctly encode character sequences that span blocks. 还保留了尾随字符数据块的末尾，并在下一步的编码操作中使用的尾随字符。The also preserves trailing characters at the end of data blocks and uses the trailing characters in the next encoding operation. 例如，一个数据块可能结尾不匹配的高代理项，并且匹配的低代理项可能在下一个数据块中。For example, a data block might end with an unmatched high surrogate, and the matching low surrogate might be in the next data block. 因此，和在网络传输和文件操作很有用，因为这些操作通常处理的数据而不是完整的数据流块。Therefore, and are useful for network transmission and file operations, because those operations often deal with blocks of data instead of a complete data stream.

.method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetMaxByteCount(int32 charCount) cil managed
Public Overrides Function GetMaxByteCount (charCount As Integer) As Integer

param.name: charCount
param.span: The number of characters to encode.

span.span: The number of characters to encode.

summary.span: Calculates the maximum number of bytes produced by encoding the specified number of characters.

span.span: Calculates the maximum number of bytes produced by encoding the specified number of characters.

returns.span: The maximum number of bytes produced by encoding the specified number of characters.

span.span: The maximum number of bytes produced by encoding the specified number of characters.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 方法计算所需的精确数组大小方法来存储所产生的字节，而方法计算最大数组大小。The method calculates the exact array size required by the method to store the resulting bytes, whereas the method calculates the maximum array size. 方法通常分配的内存越少，但方法通常执行得更快。The method generally allocates less memory, but the method generally executes faster. 是一个最坏情况的数字，包括当前所选最坏情况下。 is a worst-case number, including the worst case for the currently selected . 如果你选择了替换回退可能很大的字符串，可以返回较大的值。If you choose a replacement fallback with a potentially large string, can return large values. 方法考虑从以前的编码操作潜在剩余的代理项。The method considers potential leftover surrogates from a previous encoding operation. 因此，如果对象使用默认替换回退，或如果已在使用单个可能回退字符定义自定义替换回退，此方法返回`charCount`+ 1。As a result, if the object uses the default replacement fallback, or if a custom replacement fallback has been defined with a single possible fallback character, the method returns `charCount` + 1. 如果对象使用多个可能的回退字符使用替换回退，该方法返回*n* \* (`charCount` + 1)，其中*n*是回退的最大的数字符。If the object uses a replacement fallback with more than one possible fallback character, the method returns *n* \* (`charCount` + 1), where *n* is the maximum number of fallback characters. 与无关。 has no relation to . 如果你的应用程序需要一个用于与的类似函数，应使用。If your application needs a similar function to use with , it should use . > [!NOTE] > `GetMaxByteCount(N)` 不一定是相同的值`N* GetMaxByteCount(1)`。`GetMaxByteCount(N)` is not necessarily the same value as `N* GetMaxByteCount(1)`. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用方法来计算对指定的数目的字符进行编码所需的字节数。The following example demonstrates how to use the method to calculate the bytes required to encode a specified number of characters. [!code-cpp[System.Text.ASCIIEncoding.GetMaxByteCount Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Text.ASCIIEncoding.GetMaxByteCount Example/CPP/getmaxbytecount-int32.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Text.ASCIIEncoding.GetMaxByteCount Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Text.ASCIIEncoding.GetMaxByteCount Example/CS/getmaxbytecount-int32.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Text.ASCIIEncoding.GetMaxByteCount Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Text.ASCIIEncoding.GetMaxByteCount Example/VB/getmaxbytecount-int32.vb#1)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks 数据转换，如从流中读取的数据可以是仅在连续的块中可用。Data to be converted, such as data read from a stream, can be available only in sequential blocks. 在这种情况下，或如果的数据量太大，因此需要划分为较小的块，应用程序应使用或由方法或方法，分别。In this case, or if the amount of data is so large that it needs to be divided into smaller blocks, the application should use the or the provided by the method or the method, respectively. 不提供错误检测。 does not provide error detection. 任何大于 0x7F 十六进制的字节解码为 Unicode 问号 ("？")。Any byte greater than hexadecimal 0x7F is decoded as the Unicode question mark ("?"). > [!CAUTION] > 出于安全原因，应使用， ，或类并启用而不是使用错误检测类。For security reasons, you should use the , , or classes and enable error detection instead of using the class. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用方法将转换到字节数组。The following example demonstrates how to use the method to convert a byte array into a . [!code-cpp[System.Text.ASCIIEncoding.GetString1 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Text.ASCIIEncoding.GetString1 Example/CPP/getstring-byte[].cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Text.ASCIIEncoding.GetString1 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Text.ASCIIEncoding.GetString1 Example/CS/getstring-byte[].cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Text.ASCIIEncoding.GetString1 Example#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR_System/system.Text.ASCIIEncoding.GetString1 Example/VB/getstring-byte[].vb#1)]

summary.span: Gets a value indicating whether the current encoding uses single-byte code points.

span.span: Gets a value indicating whether the current encoding uses single-byte code points.
This property is always .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 而不是使用属性来确定用于编码操作和用于解码操作的字符数组的大小的字节数组的大小 (例如，以便字节数组的大小是\* 要的字符数编码），应调用或编码操作的方法和或用于解码操作的方法。Instead of using the property to determine the size of a byte array for encoding operations and the size of a character array for decoding operations (for example, so that the size of the byte array is \* the number of characters to be encoded), you should call the or method for encoding operations and the or method for decoding operations. 这些方法采用考虑时计算所需的数组大小的对象的替换回退策略。These methods takes the object's replacement fallback strategy into account when calculating the required array size.
